channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-16133] Footer cache in Tez AM can take too much memory
item.summary: Footer cache in Tez AM can take too much memory

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: A quick patch to test. cc prasanth_j
hagleitn perhaps you can review?
LGTM +1
The same patch for tests... doesn't look like it was in the queue
The old default was 10K entries. Do we know how much memory that would take, on average anyway. Don't want to end up with the 500MB default being larger than what 10K records would typically take.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12856897/HIVE-16133.01.patch

ERROR: -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12856897 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
sseth both the defaults would now be enforced

Nm, tests actually failed because it doesn't support both maximum size and weight. Why don't we want to end up with it taking more? 10K would take unpredictable amount of memory as far as I understand, due to wide variety in protobuf object sizes. 500Mb seems reasonable for the usual AM size (2-4Gb I assume). Should it be less? 200Mb?
cc prasanth_j
Setting the default to 256Mb and removing the old config and limit
An additional fix for the test that hardcodes the old config setting name

ATTACHMENT ID: 12857383 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Still can;t repro, but I can see errors in the logs of the last run. Apparently sometimes footer in cache gets corrupted when it's stored as a buffer. Not sure how it happens, probably the buffer object, or data, is reused somewhere and needs to be copied.

Apparently both can happen, adding BB (not the underlying data) duplicate calls; it is possible although unlikely that the footer BB is manipulated after we cache it, and on get, the footer deserialization definitely manipulates the buffer stuff, causing issues for other users.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12857431 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Committed to master. Thanks for the reviews!

Doc note: This removes hive.orc.cache.stripe.details.size from HiveConf.java and adds hive.orc.cache.stripe.details.mem.size, so the wiki needs to be updated.

  • Configuration Properties – hive.orc.cache.stripe.details.size

ORC note: hive.orc.cache.stripe.details.size is also documented in the ORC wiki, so that should be updated too:

  • ORC – Hive Configuration – Configuration Properties

Added a TODOC2.2 label.
I think there is an error in the computation of the cache size. I opened a new jira ticket:https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-17344
